physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. A, 25-year-old woman, exhibited distress about vascular markings on her nose, leading to severe concern regarding her appearance; she was initially demoralized but improved with treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially improved with imipramine but deteriorated upon seeing herself in the mirror without make-up, developing delusional certainty about the markings. After treatment with fluoxetine, she reported dramatic improvement in her concerns.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. B, 20-year-old man, had delusional beliefs about pale appearance and mis-shapen cheekbones. Treated with various medications with only partial response.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After starting clomipramine, he stopped believing that his appearance was abnormal, with social functioning improving, although depressive episodes continued.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. C, 56-year-old man, had recurrent depression and concerns about nose shape and later hair thinning. Multiple past treatments including ECT and others were attempted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After changing to clomipramine, he had significant remission from symptoms after two weeks and continued to show improvement over 8 months.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. D, 38-year-old woman, had an obsessive concern about hair symmetry, spending considerable time attempting to correct it.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After starting clomipramine, her obsessive concerns diminished after 6 weeks and continued to lessen over a follow-up period of four months.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. E, 24-year-old man, had impulsive behaviors and obsessive thoughts about the appearance of his penis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After switching from fluoxetine due to rash, he returned to clomipramine and saw improvement in body-dysmorphic symptoms.
